docs.snippet: THE lithograph was a familiar one and the man standing in front of it had a familiar look, too. On the wall was "Trial Horse" by Robert Riggs, showing a tough old battler in the ring, gloves on, dressing gown draped across his wide shoulders, whil...
docs.lead_paragraph: THE lithograph was a familiar one and the man standing in front of it had a familiar look, too. On the wall was "Trial Horse" by Robert Riggs, showing a tough old battler in the ring, gloves on, dressing gown draped across his wide shoulders, while his young opponent clambers through the ropes across the way.

docs.snippet: SAN SALVADOR--In a country where opposition groups have been largely silenced by a ruling coalition of military and business conservatives, Archbishop Oscar Arnulfo Romero of San Salvador is one of the few voices to be heard here calling for socia...
docs.lead_paragraph: SAN SALVADOR--In a country where opposition groups have been largely silenced by a ruling coalition of military and business conservatives, Archbishop Oscar Arnulfo Romero of San Salvador is one of the few voices to be heard here calling for social reform and an end to repression.
docs.abstract: Abp Oscar Arnulfo Romero, advocate of soc reform and end to repression, has become main target of right-wing campaign against alleged Communist infiltration of RC Ch; Romero appears to be untimidated, denouncing violation of human rights in strongly worded pastoral lr, criticizing Govt in his sermons and refusing open discussions with regime until repression against peasantry is halted (M)

headline.main: SALVADORAN BATTLE OF THE TWO ROMEROS; Despite a Right-Wing Campaign, Archbishop Continues to Urge President to End Repression By ALAN RIDING Special to The New York Times Church Openly Persecuted U.S. Loan Is Approved Guerrilla Groups in Action

docs.snippet: Madeline Kahn asks the key question quite early in the new Betty Comden-Adolph Green-Cy  Coleman musical, "On the 20th Century." It pops up in a flashback, one devoted to that historic moment in which zany Broadway impresario Oscar Jaffee (John Cu...
docs.lead_paragraph: Madeline Kahn asks the key question quite early in the new Betty Comden-Adolph Green-Cy Coleman musical, "On the 20th Century." It pops up in a flashback, one devoted to that historic moment in which zany Broadway impresario Oscar Jaffee (John Cullum) first lays eyes and hands on the girl who will become Lily Garland, his star, his, true love and, quite naturally as these things go, his mortal enemy.

headline.main: STAGE VIEW; Aboard the 'Twentieth Century' --Lots of Brio and a Few Bumps STAGE VIEW
